intro: Conomorpha glabra, commonly known as the smooth conomorpha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
